javadoc:
Holds options for controlling how validation is performed when determining whether or not to 
 create data structures at a particular location.

methods.javadoc: Creates a DataValidationOptions object with the default values.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a DataValidationOptions object with the default values.

methods.javadoc:
Copy constructor
@param validationOptions the data validation options to copy
methods.name: <init>

params.name: validationOptions
params.comment: the data validation options to copy

methods.javadoc:
An option indicating whether or not to follow references to other data and validate those too. If this is set to true then the data is only valid if its referred to data is also valid.
Default is true. @return true if structures should be validated for referred to data.
methods.name: shouldValidateReferredToData
methods.comment:
An option indicating whether or not to follow references to other data and validate those too.
 If this is set to true then the data is only valid if its referred to data is also valid.
 Default is true.

return.comment: true if structures should be validated for referred to data.

methods.name: setValidateReferredToData
methods.comment:
Sets whether or not to validate follow on data that is referred to by the current 
 new structure.

params.name: validateReferredToData
params.comment: true indicates follow on data should be validated.

methods.javadoc:
An option indicating whether or not existing instructions should make the location invalid for new data.
Default is false. @return false if existing instructions should cause the creation of new data to be invalid.
methods.name: shouldIgnoreInstructions
methods.comment:
An option indicating whether or not existing instructions should make the location invalid 
 for new data.
 Default is false.

return.comment: false if existing instructions should cause the creation of new data to be invalid.

methods.name: setIgnoreInstructions
methods.comment: Sets whether or not existing instructions should invalidate the creation of new data.

params.name: ignoreInstructions
params.comment:
false indicates existing instructions, where the data would be 
 created, should cause validation to fail.

methods.javadoc:
An option indicating whether or not existing defined data should make the location invalid for new data.
Default is true. @return false if existing defined data should cause the creation of new data to be invalid.
methods.name: shouldIgnoreDefinedData
methods.comment:
An option indicating whether or not existing defined data should make the location invalid 
 for new data.
 Default is true.

return.comment: false if existing defined data should cause the creation of new data to be invalid.

methods.name: setIgnoreDefinedData
methods.comment: Sets whether or not existing defined data should invalidate the creation of new data.

params.name: ignoreDefinedData
params.comment:
false indicates existing defined data, where the data would be 
 created, should cause validation to fail.

name: DataValidationOptions
comment:
Holds options for controlling how validation is performed when determining whether or not to 
 create data structures at a particular location.
